DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Laser Cryo Enrichment Performed Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code abbreviation for the process by which a frozen sample is robotically dissected via long wave laser to enrich for desired features.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A technology that allows for high-throughput laser dissection of frozen specimens. Reference slides are cut and are used to determine regions that should be retained. After review of the reference slide by a pathologist, tissues are robotically dissected in large groups. The main tissue block remains unchanged and is not chemically treated or thawed, which allows for extraction and analysis of high quality DNA, RNA, or protein._Performed; carried out.

The main tissue block remains unchanged and is not chemically treated or thawed, which allows for extraction and analysis of high quality DNA, RNA, or protein.:Performed; carried out.

Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
